reasons_to_visit.details: May often brings pleasant, mild spring weather (avg highs ~20°C/68°F) with significantly longer daylight hours, perfect for exploring Geneva, strolling the lakefront, and enjoying parks.

Experience Geneva's stunning parks like Parc La Grange (renowned rose garden starts blooming), Parc des Eaux-Vives, Jardin Anglais (Flower Clock), and the Botanical Garden at their peak spring beauty.
Terraces ('terrasses') at cafes and restaurants flourish. Enjoy drinks or meals by Lake Geneva, in the Old Town's squares, or in Carouge's charming streets.
Enjoy Geneva's attractions like the Jet d'Eau, museums, and boat trips with fewer tourists than in July/August, allowing for a more relaxed visit.
Comfortable temperatures for taking the cable car up Mont Salève for views, cycling along the Rhône or lake, or exploring the nearby Genevan vineyards.
Lake Geneva boat companies (CGN, Mouettes) operate their full spring/summer schedules, offering frequent scenic cruises and cross-lake transport.

reasons_to_reconsider.details: May can still be unpredictable, with potential for rainy days, cooler spells, or afternoon thunderstorms, even amidst the sunshine.
May sees a definite rise in tourism. Expect more people at key sites and increasing prices for flights and accommodation as high season approaches.
May 1st (Labour Day) and Ascension Day (Jeudi de l'Ascension - variable date) are public holidays with widespread shop closures.
Grass pollen levels are often high in May, potentially causing discomfort for allergy sufferers spending time in parks or the countryside.
Despite warmer air temperatures, Lake Geneva's water is generally still too cold for comfortable swimming for most people in May.

weather.precipitation: Mix of sunny, pleasant spring days and periods of rain or showers. Still potential for cooler days.
weather.general_tips: Pack layers: t-shirts, sweaters, a light to medium-weight jacket (waterproof useful), comfortable walking shoes. Sunscreen, sunglasses important for sunny days. Allergy medication if needed.

tourism_level.crowds: Moderate and increasing. Busy around May 1st holiday and potentially Ascension Day if early. More relaxed than summer peaks.
tourism_level.pricing: Shoulder/High season prices. Book ahead, especially around public holidays.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: City bursts into spring colours. Parks are magnificent. Outdoor cafe culture thrives. May 1st brings closures/demonstrations.

events_holidays.name: Labour Day (Fête du Travail)
events_holidays.description: Public holiday. Expect demonstrations, particularly around Plainpalais/city center. Widespread closures of shops, banks, offices.
events_holidays.notes: Check opening hours for museums/attractions (many open). Transport may have minor disruptions.

events_holidays.name: Geneva Marathon
events_holidays.date: Usually the first weekend of May (check exact dates)
events_holidays.description: Major running event with marathon, half-marathon, relays, and kids' races, often finishing on Pont du Mont-Blanc.
events_holidays.notes: Causes significant road closures and crowds along the route, especially on Sunday. Check official website for details.

events_holidays.name: Ascension Day (Jeudi de l'Ascension)
events_holidays.date: Varies (Thursday, 40 days after Easter - often May)
events_holidays.description: Public holiday creating a long weekend for many. Shops closed.
events_holidays.notes: Check date for the year. Attractions usually open. Can be a busy travel weekend.

unique_experiences.activity: Admire Blooms in Parc La Grange & Eaux-Vives
unique_experiences.description: Witness the spectacular display of roses (starting peak bloom) and other flowers in Geneva's premier lakeside parks.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Free entry. Perfect for strolling, picnics. Check for events at Théâtre de l'Orangerie or Théâtre de Verdure.

unique_experiences.activity: Ascend Mont Salève via Cable Car
unique_experiences.description: Take the cable car for stunning panoramic views of Geneva, Lake Geneva, the Jura, and the Alps, enhanced by clear spring air.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check weather/visibility. Bring passport (it's France). Wear layers. Restaurant/hiking trails at top.

unique_experiences.activity: Stroll the Jardin Anglais & See the Flower Clock
unique_experiences.description: Visit the famous L'horloge fleurie, newly planted for the season, and enjoy the lakeside promenade.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Easy access, central location. Combine with watching the Jet d'Eau.

unique_experiences.description: Wander the historic streets, visit St. Peter's Cathedral, browse galleries, and enjoy the atmosphere of Place du Bourg-de-Four with its outdoor cafes.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Wear comfortable shoes for hills/cobblestones. Good option regardless of weather.

weather.precipitation: Often features more stable, warm, and sunny weather, feeling like early summer, though afternoon showers/thunderstorms remain possible.
weather.general_tips: Likely need lighter clothing (t-shirts, light trousers/shorts), but keep a sweater/light jacket for evenings. Sun protection essential.

tourism_level.crowds: High season feeling develops. Busy, especially on sunny weekends and if public holidays fall late.
tourism_level.pricing: High season prices generally apply. Advance booking strongly recommended.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Beautiful late spring/early summer. Ideal conditions for enjoying the lake, parks, and outdoor dining. Vibrant city life.

events_holidays.name: Nuit des Musées (Museum Night - Potential Timing)
events_holidays.date: Often a Saturday in mid/late May (check exact dates!)
events_holidays.description: Many Geneva museums open late with special programs, workshops, music, and food, usually for a single entry fee.
events_holidays.notes: Date varies yearly! Check official program ('La Nuit des Musées Genève'). Very popular.

events_holidays.name: Whit Monday (Lundi de Pentecôte) (Potential Timing)
events_holidays.date: Varies (50 days after Easter - often late May/early June)
events_holidays.notes: Check date for the year. Attractions typically open.

unique_experiences.where: Departing from Jardin Anglais / Mont-Blanc / Eaux-Vives
unique_experiences.description: Enjoy a scenic boat trip on the lake with the full summer schedule operating. Options range from one-hour tours to longer cruises (e.g., towards Nyon, Yvoire, Lausanne).
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check CGN website for routes/timetables. Book popular cruises or weekend trips in advance. Bring sunscreen.
unique_experiences.estimated_cost: Moderate to High (depending on cruise length)

unique_experiences.description: Visit the vibrant market (Wednesdays/Saturdays), browse the unique boutiques, and enjoy the bohemian, Mediterranean atmosphere of Carouge's cafes and squares.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Accessible by tram. Market days are busiest. Ideal for finding local products and crafts.
unique_experiences.best_time: Market mornings (Wed/Sat) or daytime for shops/cafes

unique_experiences.activity: Visit the Conservatory and Botanical Garden (CJB)
unique_experiences.description: Explore the extensive outdoor gardens showcasing diverse plant collections in full spring glory, plus the greenhouses.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Free entry. Allow ample time to wander the large grounds. Restaurant on site.

unique_experiences.where: Buvette Bains des Pâquis, La Terrasse, various lakeside cafes/bars
unique_experiences.description: Relax with a drink by the water, enjoying the long evenings and views of the Jet d'Eau and lake.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Popular spots get busy, especially on sunny evenings. Bains des Pâquis is casual and affordable.
